newsitem.title: GREECE: Ecu/drachma settles at 305.65 in late thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Ecu/drachma settles at 305.65 in late thin trade.

text.p: The ecu came off highs against the drachma in late dealings trading around 305.65/75, interbank depos and forex forwards were frozen around morning levels and bonds were little changed, dealers said.
"Ecu/drachma was on the rise today but has settled around 305.65/75 in late trade," said a senior dealer at a foreign bank. "The market is thin and even small amounts can lead to wild price swings."
Ecu/drachma reached 305.90 intra-day on ecu buying for drachmas and the hitting of stop losses.
"There was some buying of ecus for drachmas which drove ecu/drachma higher," said a forex dealer. "This trend was reinforced when soem foreign players saw their stop losses hit."
Bond dealers said trading was subdued with players unwilling to sell and buy.

A total of 300 billion drachmas in competitive bids and 90 billion in non-competitive bids were allocated at the auction of 12-month T-bills on Monday. The average bid stood at 90.15 and hte cutoff price at 90.04.
The mark was quoted at 158.07/17 drachmas from Tuesday's 158.175 fix, the dollar at 259.37/47 drachmas from 259.600 and the Ecu at 305.70/80 from 305.850 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
